title: Pence won’t cooperate with House Democrats’ impeachment inquiry
text:
WASHINGTON — Vice President Mike Pence is refusing to comply with House Democrats’ request for a long list of documents as part of their impeachment inquiry.

The vice president’s counsel, Matthew E. Morgan, shared the news in a letter to the chairs of the investigating committees Tuesday evening. He’s echoing President Donald Trump’s lawyers’ complaints that the House has not held a formal vote on the investigation.

See: Rudy Giuliani tells lawmakers he won’t comply with impeachment subpoena

Morgan slammed what he’s calling a “purported ‘impeachment inquiry,’” claiming it “has been designed and implemented in a manner that calls into question” the members’ “commitment to fundamental fairness and due process rights.”

House Democrats are currently gauging support for a vote to formally authorize the impeachment inquiry in the face of White House stonewalling. Trump allies have argued that an impeachment inquiry, though declared by Speaker Nancy Pelosi last month, is not formally under way unless voted upon by lawmakers.

Pelosi was meeting privately with Democratic lawmakers late Tuesday reportedly at least in part to gauge support for such a vote.
